alert.note: Alert for Western Columbia River Gorge (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 04 at 3:46PM PDT until November 04 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE EAGLE CREEK DRAINAGE BASIN IN THE EAGLE CREEK BURN AREA REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Oregon, including the following area, Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Eagle Creek Drainage Basin in the Eagle Creek Burn Area. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Oregon, including the following area, Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Until 2 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Eagle Creek Drainage Basin in the Eagle Creek Burn Area is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Eagle Creek Drainage Basin in the Eagle Creek Burn Area should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Eagle Creek Drainage Basin in the Eagle Creek Burn Area, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Landslides and debris flows are possible during this flood event. People, structures, and roads located below steep slopes, in canyons, and near the mouths of canyons may be at serious risk from rapidly moving landslides.
